title: Is AGCO Corporation (AGCO) a Good Stock for Value Investors? - Nasdaq.com
text: Value investing is easily one of the most popular ways to find great stocks in any market environment. After all, who wouldn't want to find stocks that are either flying under the radar and are compelling buys, or offer up tantalizing discounts when compared to fair value? One way to find these companies is by looking at several key metrics and financial ratios, many of which are crucial in the value stock selection process. Let's put AGCO Corporation AGCO   stock into this equation and find out if it is a good choice for value-oriented investors right now, or if investors subscribing to this methodology should look elsewhere for top picks:  PE Ratio  A key metric that value investors always look at is the Price to Earnings Ratio, or PE for short. This shows us how much investors are willing to pay for each dollar o f earnings  in a given stock, and is easily one of the most popular financial ratios in the world. The best use of the PE ratio is to compare the stock's current PE ratio with: a) where this ratio has been in the past; b) how it compares to the average for the industry/sector; and c) how it compares to the market as a whole. On this front, AGCO Corporation has a trailing twelve months PE ratio of 15.43, as you can see in the chart below:      This level actually compares pretty favorably with the market at large, as the PE for the S&P 500 stands at about 18.36. If we focus on the long-term PE trend, AGCO Corporation's current PE level puts it below its midpoint over the past five years.      Further, the stock's PE compares favorably with the Zacks Industrial Products sector's trailing twelve months PE ratio, which stands at 16.26. At the very least, this indicates that the stock is relatively undervalued right now, compared to its peers.       We should also point out that AGCO Corporation has a forward PE ratio (price relative to this year's earnings) of just 14.46, so it is fair to say that a slightly more value-oriented path may be ahead for AGCO Corporation stock in the near term too.    P/S Ratio  Another key metric to note is the Price/Sales ratio. This approach compares a given stock's price to its total sales, where a lower reading is generally considered better. Some people like this metric more than other value-focused ones because it looks at sales, something that is far harder to manipulate with accounting tricks than earnings.  Right now, AGCO Corporation has a P/S ratio of about 0.63. This is lower than the S&P 500 average, which comes in at 3.23 right now.  Also, as we can see in the chart below, this is below the highs for this stock in particular over the past few years.       If anything, AGCO is in the lower end of its range in the time period from a P/S metric, suggesting some level of undervalued trading-at least compared to historical norms.   Broad Value Outlook  In aggregate, AGCO Corporation currently has a Zacks Value Score of A, putting it into the top 20% of all stocks we cover from this look. This makes AGCO Corporation a solid choice for value investors, and some of its other key metrics make this pretty clear too.    For example, the PEG ratio for AGCO Corporation is just 1.08, a level that is far lower than the industry average of 2.03. The PEG ratio is a modified PE ratio that takes into account the stock's earnings growth rate. Additionally, its P/CF ratio comes in at 9.62, which is lower than the industry average of 9.91. Clearly, AGCO is a solid choice on the value front from multiple angles.    What About the Stock Overall?    Though AGCO Corporation might be a good choice for value investors, there are plenty of other factors to consider before investing in this name. PE Ratio

A key metric that value investors always look at is the Price to Earnings Ratio, or PE for short. This shows us how much investors are willing to pay for each dollar o f earnings  in a given stock, and is easily one of the most popular financial ratios in the world. The best use of the PE ratio is to compare the stock's current PE ratio with: a) where this ratio has been in the past; b) how it compares to the average for the industry/sector; and c) how it compares to the market as a whole.
On this front, AGCO Corporation has a trailing twelve months PE ratio of 15.43, as you can see in the chart below:

This level actually compares pretty favorably with the market at large, as the PE for the S&P 500 stands at about 18.36. If we focus on the long-term PE trend, AGCO Corporation's current PE level puts it below its midpoint over the past five years.

Further, the stock's PE compares favorably with the Zacks Industrial Products sector's trailing twelve months PE ratio, which stands at 16.26. At the very least, this indicates that the stock is relatively undervalued right now, compared to its peers.

We should also point out that AGCO Corporation has a forward PE ratio (price relative to this year's earnings) of just 14.46, so it is fair to say that a slightly more value-oriented path may be ahead for AGCO Corporation stock in the near term too.
P/S Ratio

Another key metric to note is the Price/Sales ratio. This approach compares a given stock's price to its total sales, where a lower reading is generally considered better. Some people like this metric more than other value-focused ones because it looks at sales, something that is far harder to manipulate with accounting tricks than earnings.

Right now, AGCO Corporation has a P/S ratio of about 0.63. This is lower than the S&P 500 average, which comes in at 3.23 right now.  Also, as we can see in the chart below, this is below the highs for this stock in particular over the past few years.
If anything, AGCO is in the lower end of its range in the time period from a P/S metric, suggesting some level of undervalued trading-at least compared to historical norms.
Broad Value Outlook

For example, the PEG ratio for AGCO Corporation is just 1.08, a level that is far lower than the industry average of 2.03. The PEG ratio is a modified PE ratio that takes into account the stock's earnings growth rate. Additionally, its P/CF ratio comes in at 9.62, which is lower than the industry average of 9.91. Clearly, AGCO is a solid choice on the value front from multiple angles.
